SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319543.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Symlink Attack cpio, as used in build 2007.05.10, 2010.07.28, and possibly other versions, allows remote attackers to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink within an RPM package archive.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `cpio`.
## References
- [Support.novell.com](http://support.novell.com/security/cve/CVE-2010-4226.html)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319543.title: Symlink Attack
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319543.name: https://ftp.gnu.org|cpio@2.12

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319544.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. GNU cpio through 2.13 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted pattern file, because of a dstring.c ds_fgetstr integer overflow that triggers an out-of-bounds heap write. NOTE: it is unclear whether there are common cases where the pattern file, associated with the -E option, is untrusted data.
## Remediation
A fix was pushed into the `master` branch but not yet published.
## References
- [Git Commit](https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/cpio.git/commit/?id=dd96882877721703e19272fe25034560b794061b)
- [Github.com](https://github.com/fangqyi/cpiopwn)
- [Lists.gnu.org](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-cpio/2021-08/msg00000.html)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319544.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319544.name: https://ftp.gnu.org|cpio@2.12

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319546.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. In all versions of cpio before 2.13 does not properly validate input files when generating TAR archives. When cpio is used to create TAR archives from paths an attacker can write to, the resulting archive may contain files with permissions the attacker did not have or in paths he did not have access to. Extracting those archives from a high-privilege user without carefully reviewing them may lead to the compromise of the system.
## Remediation
Upgrade `cpio` to version 2.13 or higher.
## References
- [Lists.gnu.org](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-cpio/2019-11/msg00000.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-14866)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319546.title: Improper Input Validation
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319546.name: https://ftp.gnu.org|cpio@2.12

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319548.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution cpio 2.11, when using the --no-absolute-filenames option, allows local users to write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a file in an archive.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `cpio`.
## References
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=774669)
- [Lists.gnu.org](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-cpio/2015-01/msg00000.html)
- [OSS Security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/01/07/5)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319548.title: Arbitrary Code Execution
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CPIO-2319548.name: https://ftp.gnu.org|cpio@2.12

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317479.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read curl version curl 7.20.0 to and including curl 7.59.0 contains a CWE-126: Buffer Over-read vulnerability in denial of service that can result in curl can be tricked into reading data beyond the end of a heap based buffer used to store downloaded RTSP content.. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in curl < 7.20.0 and curl >= 7.60.0.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.60.0 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_2018-b138.html)
- [Github Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/8c7b3737d29ed5c0575bf592063de8a51450812d)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317479.title: Out-of-bounds Read
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317479.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317488.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.64.0 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2019-3822.html)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317488.title: Out-of-bounds Write
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317488.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317489.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Race Condition libcurl keeps previously used connections in a connection pool for subsequenttransfers to reuse, if one of them matches the setup.Due to errors in the logic, the config matching function did not take 'issuercert' into account and it compared the involved paths *case insensitively*,which could lead to libcurl reusing wrong connections.File paths are, or can be, case sensitive on many systems but not all, and caneven vary depending on used file systems.The comparison also didn't include the 'issuer cert' which a transfer can setto qualify how to verify the server certificate.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.77.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1223565)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317489.title: Race Condition
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317489.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

## Overview

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317500.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317506.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity. When curl >= 7.20.0 and <= 7.78.0 connects to an IMAP or POP3 server to retrieve data using STARTTLS to upgrade to TLS security, the server can respond and send back multiple responses at once that curl caches. curl would then upgrade to TLS but not flush the in-queue of cached responses but instead continue using and trustingthe responses it got *before* the TLS handshake as if they were authenticated.Using this flaw, it allows a Man-In-The-Middle attacker to first inject the fake responses, then pass-through the TLS traffic from the legitimate server and trick curl into sending data back to the user thinking the attacker's injected data comes from the TLS-protected server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.79.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334763)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317506.title: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317506.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317544.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE). A non-privileged user or program can put code and a config file in a known non-privileged path (under C:/usr/local/) that will make curl <= 7.65.1 automatically run the code (as an openssl "engine") on invocation. If that curl is invoked by a privileged user it can do anything it wants.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.65.2 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2019-5443.html)

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317552.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation libcurl-using applications can ask for a specific client certificate to be used in a transfer. This is done with the `CURLOPT_SSLCERT` option (`--cert` with the command line tool).When libcurl is built to use the macOS native TLS library Secure Transport, an application can ask for the client certificate by name or with a file name - using the same option. If the name exists as a file, it will be used instead of by name.If the appliction runs with a current working directory that is writable by other users (like `/tmp`), a malicious user can create a file name with the same name as the app wants to use by name, and thereby trick the application to use the file based cert instead of the one referred to by name making libcurl send the wrong client certificate in the TLS connection handshake.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.78.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1234760)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317552.title: Improper Certificate Validation
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317552.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write. A buffer overflow exists in curl 7.12.3 to and including curl 7.58.0 in the FTP URL handling that allows an attacker to cause a denial of service or worse.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.59.0 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_2018-9cd6.html)
- [Github Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/535432c0adb62fe167ec09621500470b6fa4eb0f)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317559.title: Out-of-bounds Write
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317559.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317561.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound curl before version 7.61.1 is vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the NTLM authentication code. The internal function Curl_ntlm_core_mk_nt_hash multiplies the length of the password by two (SUM) to figure out how large temporary storage area to allocate from the heap. The length value is then subsequently used to iterate over the password and generate output into the allocated storage buffer. On systems with a 32 bit size_t, the math to calculate SUM triggers an integer overflow when the password length exceeds 2GB (2^31 bytes). This integer overflow usually causes a very small buffer to actually get allocated instead of the intended very huge one, making the use of that buffer end up in a heap buffer overflow. (This bug is almost identical to CVE-2017-8816.)
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.61.1 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2018-14618.html)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317561.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317561.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use of Uninitialized Resource curl supports the `-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS`in libcurl. This rarely used option is used to send variable=content pairs toTELNET servers.Due to flaw in the option parser for sending `NEW_ENV` variables, libcurlcould be made to pass on uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to theserver. ## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insufficiently Protected Credentials. SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317579.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Resources Downloaded over Insecure Protocol. A user can tell curl >= 7.20.0 and <= 7.78.0 to require a successful upgrade to TLS when speaking to an IMAP, POP3 or FTP server (`--ssl-reqd` on the command line or`CURLOPT_USE_SSL` set to `CURLUSESSL_CONTROL` or `CURLUSESSL_ALL` withlibcurl). This requirement could be bypassed if the server would return a properly crafted but perfectly legitimate response.This flaw would then make curl silently continue its operations **withoutTLS** contrary to the instructions and expectations, exposing possibly sensitive data in clear text over the network.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.79.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334111)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317579.title: Resources Downloaded over Insecure Protocol
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317579.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317582.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Validation. When curl is instructed to download content using the metalink feature, thecontents is verified against a hash provided in the metalink XML file.The metalink XML file points out to the client how to get the same contentfrom a set of different URLs, potentially hosted by different servers and theclient can then download the file from one or several of them. In a serial orparallel manner.If one of the servers hosting the contents has been breached and the contentsof the specific file on that server is replaced with a modified payload, curlshould detect this when the hash of the file mismatches after a completeddownload. It should remove the contents and instead try getting the contentsfrom another URL. This is not done, and instead such a hash mismatch is onlymentioned in text and the potentially malicious content is kept in the file ondisk.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.78.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1213175)
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317582.title: Improper Validation
SNYK-UNMANAGED-CURL-2317582.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Symlink Attack cpio, as used in build 2007.05.10, 2010.07.28, and possibly other versions, allows remote attackers to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink within an RPM package archive.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `cpio`.
## References
- [Support.novell.com](http://support.novell.com/security/cve/CVE-2010-4226.html)
vulnerabilities.title: Symlink Attack
vulnerabilities.name: https://ftp.gnu.org|cpio@2.12

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. GNU cpio through 2.13 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted pattern file, because of a dstring.c ds_fgetstr integer overflow that triggers an out-of-bounds heap write. NOTE: it is unclear whether there are common cases where the pattern file, associated with the -E option, is untrusted data.
## Remediation
A fix was pushed into the `master` branch but not yet published.
## References
- [Git Commit](https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/cpio.git/commit/?id=dd96882877721703e19272fe25034560b794061b)
- [Github.com](https://github.com/fangqyi/cpiopwn)
- [Lists.gnu.org](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-cpio/2021-08/msg00000.html)
vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.name: https://ftp.gnu.org|cpio@2.12

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Input Validation. In all versions of cpio before 2.13 does not properly validate input files when generating TAR archives. When cpio is used to create TAR archives from paths an attacker can write to, the resulting archive may contain files with permissions the attacker did not have or in paths he did not have access to. Extracting those archives from a high-privilege user without carefully reviewing them may lead to the compromise of the system.
## Remediation
Upgrade `cpio` to version 2.13 or higher.
## References
- [Lists.gnu.org](https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/bug-cpio/2019-11/msg00000.html)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-14866)
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.name: https://ftp.gnu.org|cpio@2.12

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read curl version curl 7.20.0 to and including curl 7.59.0 contains a CWE-126: Buffer Over-read vulnerability in denial of service that can result in curl can be tricked into reading data beyond the end of a heap based buffer used to store downloaded RTSP content.. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in curl < 7.20.0 and curl >= 7.60.0.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.60.0 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_2018-b138.html)
- [Github Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/8c7b3737d29ed5c0575bf592063de8a51450812d)
vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. The function creating an outgoing NTLM type-3 header (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:Curl_auth_create_ntlm_type3_message()`), generates the request HTTP header contents based on previously received data. The check that exists to prevent the local buffer from getting overflowed is implemented wrongly (using unsigned math) and as such it does not prevent the overflow from happening. This output data can grow larger than the local buffer if very large 'nt response' data is extracted from a previous NTLMv2 header provided by the malicious or broken HTTP server. Such a 'large value' needs to be around 1000 bytes or more. The actual payload data copied to the target buffer comes from the NTLMv2 type-2 response header.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.64.0 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2019-3822.html)
vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Race Condition libcurl keeps previously used connections in a connection pool for subsequenttransfers to reuse, if one of them matches the setup.Due to errors in the logic, the config matching function did not take 'issuercert' into account and it compared the involved paths *case insensitively*,which could lead to libcurl reusing wrong connections.File paths are, or can be, case sensitive on many systems but not all, and caneven vary depending on used file systems.The comparison also didn't include the 'issuer cert' which a transfer can setto qualify how to verify the server certificate.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.77.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1223565)

## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Missing Initialization of Resource curl 7.7 through 7.76.1 suffers from an information disclosure when the `-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS` in libcurl, is used to send variable=content pairs to TELNET servers. Due to a flaw in the option parser for sending NEW_ENV variables, libcurl could be made to pass on uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to the server, resulting in potentially revealing sensitive internal information to the server using a clear-text network protocol.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.77.0 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.se](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2021-22898.html)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/39ce47f219b09c380b81f89fe54ac586c8db6bde)

[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read libcurl versions from 7.36.0 to before 7.64.0 is vulnerable to a heap buffer out-of-bounds read. The function handling incoming NTLM type-2 messages (`lib/vauth/ntlm.c:ntlm_decode_type2_target`) does not validate incoming data correctly and is subject to an integer overflow vulnerability. Using that overflow, a malicious or broken NTLM server could trick libcurl to accept a bad length + offset combination that would lead to a buffer read out-of-bounds.

Upgrade `curl` to version 7.64.0 or higher.

- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2018-16890.html)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity. When curl >= 7.20.0 and <= 7.78.0 connects to an IMAP or POP3 server to retrieve data using STARTTLS to upgrade to TLS security, the server can respond and send back multiple responses at once that curl caches. curl would then upgrade to TLS but not flush the in-queue of cached responses but instead continue using and trustingthe responses it got *before* the TLS handshake as if they were authenticated.Using this flaw, it allows a Man-In-The-Middle attacker to first inject the fake responses, then pass-through the TLS traffic from the legitimate server and trick curl into sending data back to the user thinking the attacker's injected data comes from the TLS-protected server.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.79.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334763)

[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Read libcurl versions from 7.34.0 to before 7.64.0 are vulnerable to a heap out-of-bounds read in the code handling the end-of-response for SMTP. vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation libcurl-using applications can ask for a specific client certificate to be used in a transfer. This is done with the `CURLOPT_SSLCERT` option (`--cert` with the command line tool).When libcurl is built to use the macOS native TLS library Secure Transport, an application can ask for the client certificate by name or with a file name - using the same option. If the name exists as a file, it will be used instead of by name.If the appliction runs with a current working directory that is writable by other users (like `/tmp`), a malicious user can create a file name with the same name as the app wants to use by name, and thereby trick the application to use the file based cert instead of the one referred to by name making libcurl send the wrong client certificate in the TLS connection handshake.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.78.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1234760)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound curl before version 7.61.1 is vulnerable to a buffer overrun in the NTLM authentication code. The internal function Curl_ntlm_core_mk_nt_hash multiplies the length of the password by two (SUM) to figure out how large temporary storage area to allocate from the heap. The length value is then subsequently used to iterate over the password and generate output into the allocated storage buffer. On systems with a 32 bit size_t, the math to calculate SUM triggers an integer overflow when the password length exceeds 2GB (2^31 bytes). This integer overflow usually causes a very small buffer to actually get allocated instead of the intended very huge one, making the use of that buffer end up in a heap buffer overflow. (This bug is almost identical to CVE-2017-8816.)
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.61.1 or higher.
## References
- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/CVE-2018-14618.html)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insufficiently Protected Credentials. When curl is instructed to get content using the metalink feature, and a user name and password are used to download the metalink XML file, those same credentials are then subsequently passed on to each of the servers from which curl will download or try to download the contents from. Often contrary to the user's expectations and intentions and without telling the user it happened.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.78.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1213181)
vulnerabilities.title: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
vulnerabilities.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to NULL Pointer Dereference. A NULL pointer dereference exists in curl 7.21.0 to and including curl 7.58.0 in the LDAP code that allows an attacker to cause a denial of service
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.59.0 or higher.

## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Out-of-bounds Write curl version curl 7.54.1 to and including curl 7.59.0 contains a CWE-122: Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability in denial of service and more that can result in curl might overflow a heap based memory buffer when closing down an FTP connection with very long server command replies.. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in curl < 7.54.1 and curl >= 7.60.0.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.60.0 or higher.

- [Curl.haxx.se](https://curl.haxx.se/docs/adv_2018-82c2.html)
- [Github Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/583b42cb3b809b1bf597af160468ccba728c2248)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Resources Downloaded over Insecure Protocol. A user can tell curl >= 7.20.0 and <= 7.78.0 to require a successful upgrade to TLS when speaking to an IMAP, POP3 or FTP server (`--ssl-reqd` on the command line or`CURLOPT_USE_SSL` set to `CURLUSESSL_CONTROL` or `CURLUSESSL_ALL` withlibcurl). This requirement could be bypassed if the server would return a properly crafted but perfectly legitimate response.This flaw would then make curl silently continue its operations **withoutTLS** contrary to the instructions and expectations, exposing possibly sensitive data in clear text over the network.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.79.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334111)
vulnerabilities.title: Resources Downloaded over Insecure Protocol

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Validation. When curl is instructed to download content using the metalink feature, thecontents is verified against a hash provided in the metalink XML file.The metalink XML file points out to the client how to get the same contentfrom a set of different URLs, potentially hosted by different servers and theclient can then download the file from one or several of them. In a serial orparallel manner.If one of the servers hosting the contents has been breached and the contentsof the specific file on that server is replaced with a modified payload, curlshould detect this when the hash of the file mismatches after a completeddownload. It should remove the contents and instead try getting the contentsfrom another URL. This is not done, and instead such a hash mismatch is onlymentioned in text and the potentially malicious content is kept in the file ondisk.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.78.0 or higher.
## References
- [HackerOne Report](https://hackerone.com/reports/1213175)
vulnerabilities.title: Improper Validation
vulnerabilities.name: https://curl.se|curl@7.58.0

## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Open Redirect which can leak authentication or cookie header data. This is due to an incomplete fix of [CVE-2018-1000007](https://security.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-CENTOS7-LIBCURL-2130237).
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.83.0 or higher.

- [Curl docs](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2022-27776.html)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/6e659993952aa5f90f488)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2078408)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Insufficiently Protected Credentials. This is because the `same host` check does not work on cross-protocol redirects and it does not consider different port numbers to be separate hosts.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.83.0 or higher.
## References
- [Curl docs](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2022-27774.html)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/139a54ed0a172ada)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/620ea21410030a997)
- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2077547)

vulnerabilities.description:
## Overview
[curl](https://curl.se) is a command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure when it allows HTTP cookies to be set for Top Level Domains (TLDs) if the hostname is provided with a trailing dot. This issue allows arbitrary sites to set cookies that then would get sent to a different and unrelated site or domain by a malicious actor.
## Remediation
Upgrade `curl` to version 7.83.1 or higher.
## References
- [Curl Security Advisory](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2022-27779.html)
- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/7e92d12b4e6911f)
